results.title: Vision. [No. 27]
results.creator_credit: United States Information Agency, SA Films and Sidney R Aronson
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine: Senior softball - a softball league whose players are all 75 years of age or older; Busch Gardens - where people enjoy riding, animal shows etc; Hamburger University - the school training thoe who operate McDonald’s restaurants; house-on-the rocks - a ‘castle in the sky’ perched on top of a rugged 450 foot high chimney rock; Harpers Ferry - John Sergem, wood carver, creates plaques, busts and other exhibits for display in national parks; Eva Jessye - one of the great names in Black American music.

results.title: Vision. [No. 22]
results.creator_credit: United States Information Agency, Ted Steeg Productions, Jim Strongin and Ted Steeg
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine: the work and use of the radio telescope in West Virginia; a policewoman explains her job, training and off duty life in Washington; problems of the retired and the handicapped as tackled by the Retired Senior Volunteer Program; making dolls to reflect authentic period in American history; the cleaning up of Lake Washington by the community in Seattle and the 18 acre San Diego Wild Animal Park which aims to reproduce in captivity animals which otherwise might become extinct. Narrated by Michael Tolan.
results.creator_credit_for_label: United States Information Agency, Ted Steeg Productions, Jim Strongin and Ted Steeg

results.title: Vision of Galileo
results.creator_credit: Italo Costa and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Nature of things”.
Visits the cities in which Galileo lived and worked: Pisa, Florence, Padua, Venice and Rome. Also repeats some of his experiments and explains them in a script based largely on Galileo’s own writings. With David Suzuki. Suitable for upper secondary level.
